task.name: hif_export_calstate
task.shortdescription: Save the pipeline calibration state to disk
task.description: hif_export_calstate saves the current pipeline calibration state to disk in the form of a set of equivalent applycal calls.
task.example:
hif_export_calstate saves the current pipeline calibration state to disk in the form of a set of equivalent applycal calls.
Keyword arguments:
filename -- Name for the saved calibration state.
Description
hif_export_calstate saves the current pipeline calibration state to disk in the form of a set of equivalent applycal calls.
If filename is not given, hif_export_calstate saves the calibration state to disk with a filename based on the pipeline context creation time, using the extension '.calstate'
Issues
If run several times in one pipeline session does the automatic export file naming scheme, overwrite previous versions?
Example
1. Save the calibration state.
hif_export_calstate()
2. Save the calibration state in a user supplied file.
hif_export_calstate(filename='afterbandpass.calstate')
